manifest.name: hashicorp_vault
manifest.title: Hashicorp Vault
manifest.description: Collect logs and metrics from Hashicorp Vault with Elastic Agent.

policy_templates.name: hashicorp_vault
policy_templates.title: Hashicorp Vault
policy_templates.description: Collect logs and monitor Hashicorp Vault.

inputs.title: Logs from TCP socket
inputs.description: Collect Vault audit logs sent via TCP.

streams.description: Collect Vault audit logs from file.
streams.title: Audit logs (file audit device)

vars.name: preserve_original_event
vars.description: Preserves a raw copy of the original event, added to the field `event.original`.
vars.title: Preserve original event

vars.name: processors
vars.description: Processors are used to reduce the number of fields in the exported event or to enhance the event with metadata.  This executes in the agent before the logs are parsed. See [Processors](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/beats/filebeat/current/filtering-and-enhancing-data.html) for details.
vars.title: Processors

streams.description: Collect Vault audit logs from TCP socket.
streams.title: Audit logs (socket audit device)

vars.name: listen_address
vars.description: The bind address to listen for TCP connections. Set to `0.0.0.0` to bind to all available interfaces.
vars.title: Listen Address

vars.name: listen_port
vars.description: The TCP port number to listen on.
vars.title: Listen Port

vars.name: preserve_original_event
vars.description: Preserves a raw copy of the original event, added to the field `event.original`.
vars.title: Preserve original event

vars.name: processors
vars.description: Processors are used to reduce the number of fields in the exported event or to enhance the event with metadata.  This executes in the agent before the logs are parsed. See [Processors](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/beats/filebeat/current/filtering-and-enhancing-data.html) for details.
vars.title: Processors

default.yml.description: Pipeline for processing Hashicorp Vault audit logs.

fields.name: log.source.address
fields.description: Source address (IP and port) of the log message.

fields.name: data_stream.type
fields.description: Data stream type.

fields.name: data_stream.dataset
fields.description: Data stream dataset.

fields.name: data_stream.namespace
fields.description: Data stream namespace.

fields.name: @timestamp
fields.description: Event timestamp.

fields.name: event.module
fields.description: Event module

fields.name: event.dataset
fields.description: Event dataset

fields.name: accessor
fields.description: This is an HMAC of the client token accessor

fields.name: client_token
fields.description: This is an HMAC of the client's token ID.

fields.name: display_name
fields.description: Display name is a non-security sensitive identifier that is applicable to this auth. It is used for logging and prefixing of dynamic secrets. For example, it may be "armon" for the github credential backend. If the client token is used to generate a SQL credential, the user may be "github-armon-uuid". This is to help identify the source without using audit tables.

fields.name: entity_id
fields.description: Entity ID is the identifier of the entity in identity store to which the identity of the authenticating client belongs to.

fields.name: external_namespace_policies
fields.description: External namespace policies represent the policies authorized from different namespaces indexed by respective namespace identifiers.

fields.name: identity_policies
fields.description: These are the policies sourced from the identity.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: This will contain a list of metadata key/value pairs associated with the authenticated user.

fields.name: no_default_policy
fields.description: Indicates that the default policy should not be added by core when creating a token. The default policy will still be added if it's explicitly defined.

fields.name: policies
fields.description: Policies is the list of policies that the authenticated user is associated with.

fields.name: token_policies
fields.description: These are the policies sourced from the token.

fields.name: entity_created
fields.description: entity_created is set to true if an entity is created as part of a login request.

fields.name: error
fields.description: If an error occurred with the request, the error message is included in this field's value.

fields.name: client_certificate_serial_number
fields.description: Serial number from the client's certificate.

fields.name: client_token
fields.description: This is an HMAC of the client's token ID.

fields.name: client_token_accessor
fields.description: This is an HMAC of the client token accessor.

fields.name: data
fields.description: The data object will contain secret data in key/value pairs.

fields.name: headers
fields.description: Additional HTTP headers specified by the client as part of the request.

fields.name: id
fields.description: This is the unique request identifier.

fields.name: operation
fields.description: This is the type of operation which corresponds to path capabilities and is expected to be one of: create, read, update, delete, or list.

fields.name: path
fields.description: The requested Vault path for operation.

fields.name: policy_override
fields.description: Policy override indicates that the requestor wishes to override soft-mandatory Sentinel policies.

fields.name: remote_address
fields.description: The IP address of the client making the request.

fields.name: remote_port
fields.description: The remote port of the client making the request.

fields.name: replication_cluster
fields.description: Name given to the replication secondary where this request originated.

fields.name: wrap_ttl
fields.description: If the token is wrapped, this displays configured wrapped TTL in seconds.

fields.name: auth
fields.description: Authentication information for this response.

fields.name: token_ttl
fields.description: Time to live for the token in seconds.

fields.name: data
fields.description: Response payload.

fields.name: headers
fields.description: Headers will contain the http headers from the plugin that it wishes to have as part of the output.

fields.name: redirect
fields.description: Redirect is an HTTP URL to redirect to for further authentication. This is only valid for credential backends. This will be blanked for any logical backend and ignored.

fields.name: wrap_info
fields.description: Information for wrapping the response in a cubbyhole.

fields.name: accessor
fields.description: The token accessor for the wrapped response token.

fields.name: creation_path
fields.description: Creation path is the original request path that was used to create the wrapped response.

fields.name: creation_time
fields.description: The creation time. This can be used with the TTL to figure out an expected expiration.

fields.name: token
fields.description: The token containing the wrapped response.

fields.name: ttl
fields.description: Specifies the desired TTL of the wrapping token.

fields.name: wrapped_accessor
fields.description: The token accessor for the wrapped response token.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Audit record type (request or response).

fields.name: nomad.allocation.id
fields.description: Nomad allocation ID

fields.name: nomad.namespace
fields.description: Nomad namespace.

fields.name: nomad.node.id
fields.description: Nomad node ID.

fields.name: nomad.task.name
fields.description: Nomad task name.

streams.description: Collect Vault operational logs from file.
streams.title: Operation logs

vars.name: preserve_original_event
vars.description: Preserves a raw copy of the original event, added to the field `event.original`.
vars.title: Preserve original event

vars.name: processors
vars.description: Processors are used to reduce the number of fields in the exported event or to enhance the event with metadata.  This executes in the agent before the logs are parsed. See [Processors](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/beats/filebeat/current/filtering-and-enhancing-data.html) for details.
vars.title: Processors

default.yml.description: Pipeline for processing Hashicorp Vault operational logs.

fields.name: data_stream.type
fields.description: Data stream type.

fields.name: data_stream.dataset
fields.description: Data stream dataset.

fields.name: data_stream.namespace
fields.description: Data stream namespace.

fields.name: @timestamp
fields.description: Event timestamp.

fields.name: event.module
fields.description: Event module

fields.name: event.dataset
fields.description: Event dataset

vars.name: hosts
vars.description: Vault addresses to monitor. `/v1/sys/metrics?format=prometheus` is automatically appended.
vars.title: Hosts

vars.name: vault_token
vars.description: A Vault token with read access to the /sys/metrics API.
vars.title: Vault Token

vars.name: processors
vars.description: Processors are used to reduce the number of fields in the exported event or to enhance the event with metadata. This executes in the agent before the logs are parsed. See [Processors](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/beats/metricbeat/current/filtering-and-enhancing-data.html) for details.
vars.title: Processors

default.yml.description: Pipeline for processing Hashicorp Vault metrics.

fields.name: data_stream.type
fields.description: Data stream type.

fields.name: data_stream.dataset
fields.description: Data stream dataset.

fields.name: data_stream.namespace
fields.description: Data stream namespace.

fields.name: @timestamp
fields.description: Event timestamp.

fields.name: event.module
fields.description: Event module

fields.name: event.dataset
fields.description: Event dataset

fields.name: hashicorp_vault.metrics.*.*
fields.description: Hashicorp Vault telemetry data from the Prometheus endpoint.

fields.name: auth_method
fields.description: Authorization engine type.

fields.name: cluster
fields.description: The cluster name from which the metric originated; set in the configuration file, or automatically generated when a cluster is created.

fields.name: creation_ttl
fields.description: Time-to-live value assigned to a token or lease at creation. This value is rounded up to the next-highest bucket; the available buckets are 1m, 10m, 20m, 1h, 2h, 1d, 2d, 7d, and 30d. Any longer TTL is assigned the value +Inf.

fields.name: mount_point
fields.description: Path at which an auth method or secret engine is mounted.

fields.name: namespace
fields.description: A namespace path, or root for the root namespace

fields.name: token_type
fields.description: Identifies whether the token is a batch token or a service token.
